question: Managers use different methods to control performance in an organization, focusing on ________.
Quality control ensures that the product or service meets the required ________.
A company manufacturing soft drinks checks if every bottle is properly ________ to ensure quality.
Quantity control ensures that production meets the required ________ target.
A bakery must produce ________ loaves of bread daily to meet its quantity target.
If only 800 loaves are made, the supervisor must increase efficiency by adjusting ________ or using better equipment.
Time control ensures that tasks are completed on ________.
A courier company promises ________ delivery to maintain customer satisfaction.
If deliveries take more than 24 hours, the manager may investigate ________ and change the route planning.
Cost control ensures that expenses remain within the ________.
A hotel sets a budget of ₹500 per meal. If the cost rises to ₹600, the supervisor must find ways to ________ waste or buy cheaper ingredients.
Measuring performance involves checking ________ such as output, quality, time taken, or cost spent.
A bank tracks how many loans an employee processes daily to ________ performance.
Comparing with standards involves checking if performance meets the required ________.
If an employee should process 20 loans per day but only processes 15, performance is ________ standard.
Correcting deviations involves taking action to ________ mistakes.
The bank may introduce faster software or train employees to ________ loan processing speed.
Controlling at the supervisory level ensures that employees meet their targets in ________.
By monitoring performance, comparing results with standards, and taking corrective action, managers ensure ________ operations and customer satisfaction.
Quality control methods ensure that products meet the required ________ before they are released to the market.
A company manufacturing soft drinks checks if every bottle has the right amount of liquid to ensure ________ control.
Quantity control ensures that production meets the required ________ to fulfill customer demand.
A bakery must produce 1,000 loaves of bread daily to meet its ________ target.
If only 800 loaves are made, the supervisor must increase efficiency by adjusting ________ or using better equipment.
Time control ensures that tasks are completed on ________ to meet deadlines.
A courier company promises 24-hour delivery to maintain ________ satisfaction.
If deliveries take more than 24 hours, the manager may investigate ________ and change the route planning.
Cost control ensures that expenses remain within the ________ to avoid financial losses.
A hotel sets a budget of ₹500 per meal. If the cost rises to ₹600, the supervisor must find ways to ________ waste or optimize resources.
Measuring performance involves checking ________ such as output, quality, time taken, or cost spent to evaluate efficiency.
A bank tracks how many loans an employee processes daily to ________ performance and identify areas for improvement.
Comparing with standards involves checking if performance meets the required ________ to ensure quality and efficiency.
If an employee should process 20 loans per day but only processes 15, performance is ________ the standard.
Correcting deviations involves taking action to ________ mistakes and improve performance.
The bank may introduce faster software or train employees to ________ loan processing efficiency.
Controlling at the supervisory level ensures that employees meet their targets in ________ to achieve organizational goals.
By monitoring performance, comparing results with standards, and taking corrective action, managers ensure ________ operations and high customer satisfaction.
Quality control methods ensure that products meet the required ________ before they are released to the market to maintain customer trust.
A company manufacturing soft drinks checks if every bottle has the right amount of liquid to ensure ________ control and prevent waste.
Quantity control ensures that production meets the required ________ to fulfill customer orders.
A bakery must produce 1,000 loaves of bread daily to meet its ________ target and avoid shortages.
If only 800 loaves are made, the supervisor must increase efficiency by adjusting ________ or using better equipment to meet demand.
Time control ensures that tasks are completed on ________ to meet deadlines and maintain customer satisfaction.
A courier company promises 24-hour delivery to maintain ________ satisfaction and build customer loyalty.
If deliveries take more than 24 hours, the manager may investigate ________ and change the route planning to improve efficiency.
Cost control ensures that expenses remain within the ________ to avoid financial losses and maintain profitability.
A hotel sets a budget of ₹500 per meal. If the cost rises to ₹600, the supervisor must find ways to ________ waste or optimize resources to reduce expenses.
Measuring performance involves checking ________ such as output, quality, time taken, or cost spent to evaluate organizational efficiency.
A bank tracks how many loans an employee processes daily to ________ performance and identify areas for improvement to enhance productivity.
Comparing with standards involves checking if performance meets the required ________ to ensure quality, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
